Description: Vase of red pottery: originally polished on the exterior, but largely blackened by burning. The vase has a flat base, from which the sides expand to form a wide body, then converge again to a narrow neck. The rim is slightly broken. Within the vase are remains of the original contents. Cracked in places.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), 6, pl. VIII, 3 (probably).
